word:
Brookfield, N. Y., October, 30, 1859
     My Dear Henry and Edson: I will write you a few lines. You remember, Henry, in my last letter to you I made a suggestion of what I thought to be a good plan. I do not enforce this; I merely suggest it. I would not bind anything upon you that is tedious or burdensome. But I thought such a plan 
54
as I suggested, if you could see the help it would be to you in having a principle, and in forming a good character, you would readily adopt it.
